dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DRIFT over a scene of Saturday afternoon Americana, a Little League baseball game and cookout at the town FIELD a peaceful suburban community-

dialogues.speaker: GROUND LEVEL
dialogues.text: A DAD in a grease-spattered apron flips steaks, burgers a dogs on the grill with a long-handled fork~

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: A little YAPPY DOG scoots around BARKING with apoplectic at the end of its leash, secured to gardening stake whack into the ground at the edge of the parking lot-

dialogues.speaker: BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: PARENTS CHEER their children on-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Come on, Joshua, rip the cover off the ball! TIMMY’S FATHER Buckle down, fellas! On your toes out there! Joshua’s mother sits with little REBECCA, no more than tw three years old, standing on the bleacher seats beside he and her bespectacled son BENJAMIN immersed in a Harry Pot book on the other side. Behind her is a VIDEO ENTHUSIAST parent, recording everything with a high-end VIDEO CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Come on, honey, lay into it! (nudging Benjamin) Benjamin, stop reading, your brother‘’s up-

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: I’m aware of that, Mother. We PAN to the FIELD just as JOSHUA swings and hits a grou between first and second- JOSHUA‘S MOTHER Run! Run! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball continues into RIGHT FIELD, where little TIMMY, e ba GH major league material, lets it roll between his legs, tur and kicks it a few times before finally picking it up and launching an anemic throw toward the infield, to the chor of-

dialogues.speaker: TEAMMATES
dialogues.text: Throw it! Throw the ball! Throw it!

dialogues.speaker: INFIELD
dialogues.text: The ball is retrieved by the first baseman, who hurls it the shortstop covering second, but Joshua is already stan happily on top of the bag. The PITCHER is furious, yellin out to Timmy-

dialogues.speaker: PITCHER
dialogues.text: All you got to do is pick it up and throw it! You’re such a spaz!

dialogues.speaker: COACH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, none of that! We PAN to see the COACH standing in front of the BENCH of team in the field-

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: I'll handle the coaching, here!

dialogues.speaker: PITCHER
dialogues.text: Do we have to have him out there?

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: Just get back on the mound, Mister. The Pitcher kicks the dirt and returns to the mound, as t Coach turns angrily to Timmy-

dialogues.speaker: COACH
dialogues.text: Keep your head down on those grounders and throw ahead of the runner! You're out there pickin daisies!

dialogues.speaker: BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: Timmy's father puts his head in his hands, humiliated-  w

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: He got a double! ‘e

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (still reading) A single and an error. PITCHER’S FATHER That kid in right couldn’t catch a cold in flu season.

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Come on, Eli, bring him in!

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT FIELD
dialogues.text: Timmy dejectedly walks back to his position. A large SHAD sweeps over him-

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Yappy Dog is yapping, yapping, then senses something abov ® and freezes, looking up. He starts to WHIMPER-

dialogues.speaker: BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: Little Rebecca is looking up into the sky, fascinated-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Good eyes, Eli! Way to look!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: (points) Look, Mommy, birdy-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: (not looking up) This is your pitch now! Get some aluminum on it!

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Birdy, Mommy, birdy-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: (still not looking) That's nice, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘e

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: The pitch- CLINK! Eli lifts a very high pop-up into- oh n right field!

dialogues.speaker: BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: TIMMY‘'S FATHER Get under it son! You got it Timmy !

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Drop it! Drop it! Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT FIELD
dialogues.text: Timmy unsteadily wobbles under the pop-up, everyone on an off the field SHOUTING instructions at him-

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: The baseball keeps rising, rising- FWOOSH! A huge black PTEROSAUR swoops out of the heights and snatches the ball its razor-toothed bill, then wings away with powerful strokes!

dialogues.speaker: TIMMY
dialogues.text: Frozen in amazement, glove still ready for the ball that won't be coming down for him to drop-

dialogues.speaker: BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: The SPECTATORS are stunned speechless, gaping up at the s Little Rebecca giggles-

dialogues.speaker: REBECCA
dialogues.text: Big birdy!

dialogues.speaker: PICNIC AREA
dialogues.text: The barbecuing Dad stands frozen with a half-done steak suspended on his fork, trying to make sense of what he ju saw-  © ©

dialogues.speaker: BARBECUE DAD
dialogues.text: What the- FWAP! Another PTEROSAUR swoops down from behind and snatc the steak off his fork!

dialogues.speaker: BARBECUE DAD
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: We shoot from behind the bleachers toward the field and t sky above it. A BLACK SHAPE takes form, winging in over t fence in center field-

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: The Spectators are standing up, concerned-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look! Up in the sky! It's a- a-

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (interested now) It’s some sort of pterosaur, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S COMING AT US
dialogues.text: Joshua's Mother grabs little Rebecca and ducks with all t Spectators as the PTEROSAUR buzzes the bleachers, SQUAWKI with menace! Only the Video Enthusiast and Benjamin remai standing-

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: There's a whole flock of them, though ‘flock’ might not be the right word- Joshua’s Mother grabs his arm and yanks him down, turns screaming to the field-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Joshua, run! Run!

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: Tt locks like a WWI cogfight over the infield, a half-doz PTEROSAURS wheeling and swooping, SQUAWKING hellaciously, LITTLE LEAGUERS scrambling in all directions-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA
dialogues.text: Joshua begins to run down the basepath towards third, a PTEROSAUR flapping after him. As he rounds third the beas makes a lunge, narrowly missing the boy with its talons. Joshua sprints toward home plate and his mother in the bleachers beyond, the pterosaur wheeling and pursuing-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Standing with her daughter in arms now, screaming out- JOSHUA’S MOTHER Run, Joshua, run! Slide!

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA
dialogues.text: Just as the PTEROSAUR makes another snatch for him Joshua slides under its grasp and across home plate! The pterosa streaks past, busting partially through the nylon mesh of backstop, SQUAWKING and struggling as it becomes entangle

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: We SWOOP down from above at the no longer yapping Yappy D

dialogues.speaker: DOG
dialogues.text: The dog WHIMPERS, takes a hard run- THOONK! and pulls the stake clear out of the ground, scampering away with it trailing him till- FWACK! the swooping PTEROSAUR scoops i and swallows it, flapping away with the leash and stake dangling from its bill!

dialogues.speaker: PICNIC AREA
dialogues.text: FAMILY MEMBERS running every whichway as they are dive-bo by PTEROSAURS-—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A. PTEROSAUR crouches on a blanket on the ground, wolfing the abandoned picnic food- Barbecue Dad fends one flying menace eff with his long fo then dives under a PICNIC TABLE for refuge-

dialogues.speaker: FIELD
dialogues.text: General panic on the field. The Pitcher has been standing petrified on the mound throughout, too scared to run or e lie down- His Father is starting out to him from the sidelines, muc impeded by swooping, SQUAWKING PTEROSAURS- PITCHER’S FATHER Just stay right there, Alex! I'm coming for you! But a PTEROSAUR does a Stuka-dive over the backstop and F grabs the boy by the shoulders, lifting him away-

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The flying beast flaps hard, trying to get some altitude, lugging the Pitcher only a few feet off the ground as it heads straight toward Timmy in right field! Timmy's Father is running out toward him, aluminum BASEBA BAT in hand- TIMMY ‘S FATHER Grab him, Timmy! Grab him!

dialogues.speaker: TIMMY
dialogues.text: Timmy pulls his glove off, estimates, then jumps just as PTEROSAUR is starting to lift off, grabbing the Pitcher's legs with both arms! The extra weight pulls the beast dow close enough to the ground that WHAP! WHAP! WHAP! Timmy's father can start whomping it with the bat. The pterosaur lets the Pitcher go, he and Timmy tumbling to the ground, then flaps away CROAKING a DISTRESS CALL- The Pitcher’s father and Timmy’s father help the boys up- TIMMY ‘S FATHER Nice grab, son. Way to use your head.  ‘e The VIDEO ENTHUSIAST steps past them, pointing his camera the sky-

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO ENTHUSIAST
dialogues.text: I think they're leaving! We PAN to see what he’s taping- a PHALANX of PTERCSAURS winging away together-

dialogues.speaker: INFIELD
dialogues.text: We TRACK through freaked-out Little Leaguers and their freaked-out parents, trying to comfort them, till we reac home plate where Joshua's Mother is on her knees hugging Joshua as little Rebecca and Benjamin stand by-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Oh, Joshua, that was wonderful! You were so brave!

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: He didn‘t touch third. She gives her bookworm son a withering look-

dialogues.speaker: JOSHUA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: This is the last baseball game I take you to, young man.

dialogues.speaker: BENJAMIN
dialogues.text: (prightening) Promise?

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTOP
dialogues.text: The thoroughly enmeshed PTEROSAUR caught in the backstop netting SCREAMS in frustration—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start on a TV NEWS image of the struggling PTEROSAUR, wrapped .in cut-away backstop netting and with a plastic RESTRAINT holding its bill shut, being carefully carried shell-shocked LITTLE LEAGUERS and PARENTS by a pair of bl uniformed SWAT TEAM members-

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSWOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The attack, the first occurring within U.S. territory, left several people badly shaken but resulted in no serious injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We switch to hand-held HOME VIDEO FOOTAGE shot by the Enthusiast at the game- swooping pterosaurs, screaming humans -

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSWOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Similar incidents have plagued communities in Central America and Mexico in recent months, leading to the formation of a United Nations task force to exterminate the intrusive pterosaurs. We switch to more professional footage of a pair of littl COMPSOGNATHUS floating on a natural raft of coconut shell and other debris on the OCEAN-

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSWOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: These and a few other formerly extinct species have migrated to the mainland- TV IMAGE - an AERIAL SHOT of ISLA NUBLAR-

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSWOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -from Isla Nublar, site of the notorious Jurassic Park disaster- TV IMAGE - a dusty street in a CENTRAL AMERICAN TOWN. A FLOCK of scrawny CHICKENS run underfoot in a panic, PEDESTRIANS jump onto cars as a small band of COMPSOGNATH dart around after the chickens. A big hen goes down, FEATHERS flying as the compys dive onto it-

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSWOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ~causing untold damage to crops and livestock. Wilhelm Speiler- A business-suited corporate flak-catcher, SPEILER, appear screen standing before a large CORPORATE LOGO-

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSWOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -spokesman for Grendel Corporation, the Swiss firm now responsible for the island, had this to say-

dialogues.speaker: SPEILER, (TV)
dialogues.text: (slight Swiss accent) Our eradication of the genetically engineered creatures at the former Jurassic Park is nearly complete. We believe that these current depredations-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK HARRIS, a currently unemployed scldier of fortune, watches the TV sceptically as he stands at the counter of

dialogues.speaker: SPEILER, (TV)
dialogues.text: -can be attributed to animals that escaped the island before we at Grendel took possession of it. Harris pushes aside his empty whiskey glass and steps awa

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Right, buddy-

dialogues.speaker: SPEILER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We can only regret that we were not given the opportunity to respond to this situation earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris squints as the sun hits him. He has a day-old stub on his face and the air of a man who's unhappily killing time. We TRACK with him as he moves down the BOARDWALK pa various BEACH TYPES. A SHADOW drifts over him. He looks u

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: Swooping low overhead are two, no, three-- PELICANS. Similar outline but without the size and the teeth-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: BOARDWALK
dialogues.text: JEB OVERTON, wearing a quasi-military UNIFORM, approaches Nick with a halting gait-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: It’s you, right? Nick looks him over, smiles slightly-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Captain Overton.  ll.

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I look more like Captain Crunch in this outfit. I haven’t seen you since-- He doesn’t finish the sentence. The place they last saw e other is not one either wishes to reminisce about-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: Have you heard from any of the guys?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Haven’t been in the loop for a while.

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: Wilkens drove his car off a cliff. DeStefano-- well, peacetime is rough for a lot of people.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: How bout you?

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m the bionic security guard. He hitches up his pants slightly to reveal his ankles- CHROMIUM prosthetics. Both legs are artificial below the knees-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: State of the art. I’m in charge of the lock-up over at the aviary- He indicates the large HUMMINGBIRD PATCH on the breast po of his uniform-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: -this, like, giant zoo for birds-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I always said you were for the birds.

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: (grins) Listen, are you still- consulting?  e 12.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (grim) Haven't had a contract in three years.

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: But if there was one, good money, a little travel, a little adventure-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You’ve been looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: More or less. Harris looks out over the beach. Lots of people having fu

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s not exactly a stepping-stone to bigger and better things, what we do, is it? He sighs, resigned-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Who's it for?

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: Well- he’s kind of strange-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EMU faces us in threat posture, the big, flightless bi making a deep THUMPING noise as it vibrates its massive c

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They can get rather territorial in captivity.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Nick and JOHN HAMMOND stroll down a pathway through a sec of high grass in the AVIARY. High above them is a domed CEILING of net, all around are outcroppings of foliage an busy BIRDS. A sturdy NURSE follows them several yards beh

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Of course it doesn’t put me in the best of moods, either.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You’re not in captivity.  é ©@ Hemmond shoots a quick lock back to the nurse-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: You just can’t see the chains. My late heir managed to get me declared incompetent, my minders are bribed to spy upon me for my enemies-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You have enemies?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Did you know that I am the most- sued person in the history of the world? It’s in the Guinness Book, you could look it up. Prominent law schools devote entire semesters to my malfeasances, regulatory statutes bear my name- not the legacy I had in mind when I started out, but a legacy nonetheless. They pass some beautiful ROSEATE SPOONBILLS wading throug shallow pond-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: We look back at our lives and we try to tally up the things we are proud of against the regrets-- do you have regrets, Mr. Harris?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (nods) More than a few.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: At the moment, my greatest regret, other than having spawned the careers of thousands of tort lawyers, is having put an evil into the world that may become permanent- an evil that must be eliminated before it spirals out of control.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Your dinosaurs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yes. My dinosaurs. How much do you know about them?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Most of them have been wiped out. A couple species have been making a nuisance of themselves-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Whenever a new organism, especially a predator with no natural enemies, is introduced into an ecosystem, the result is disastrous.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Pest control isn’t in my line-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I’m not proposing you run about with a butterfly net, Mr. Harris. The most effective weapon against any species is its own behavior- particularly its reproductive behavior. Take a population of any wild animal and introduce a number of highly aggressive but reproductively-neutered individuals within it- a ‘Judas strain’, so to speak-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Cuts down on the birth rate.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Who better to locate our errant creatures than their almost identical kin-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Why not give them diseases, too?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Viruses mutate faster than lawsuits, I'm afraid. Too much risk they'd begin to affect other species. But a large influx of young, aggressive, sterile but sexually attractive females-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sounds like a college boy’s dream-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: And the only solution, I believe, to our present crisis.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good to me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: But not to the United Nations. They‘ve laughed off my proposals, outlawed not only the creation of any new dinosaurs, sterile or not, but also prohibited the world-wide mining, sale or possession of amber-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No little mosquitoes trapped in tree sap-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: -means no basic genetic material to work with.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But even if you had these genes, you couldn‘t-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Among the people on the board of this aviary, funded through a trust I set up before my legal difficulties began, are some of the finest genetic scientists in the world. People who would be happy to risk implementing my plan- if a source of the vital DNA could be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: located.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Something tells me you've found one.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I didn't find it, I left it behind. A former employee of mine, a Mr. Nedry-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see NEDRY opening a safety vault disguised as an AEROS CAN and sticking pilfered tubes of dinosaur embryo into i 2  e

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND, (V.C.)
dialogues.text: -at the behest of one of m, more unscrupulous competitors, conspired to steal a large quantity of genetic material, enough to engender at least forty species, from our laboratory at the Park. It was his misfortune, however-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nedry’s vehicle slides out of control in the torrential downpour, leaving the road and coming to rest, stuck in t muck-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -to attempt this clandestine transaction during a- a period a severe technical malfunction at the facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nedry faces off with a large, curious Chlamydosaurus Sput (‘spitting frilled lizard’ or ‘Spitter’). Its FRILLS pop and it HAWKS a throatful of nasty black stuff into Nedry’ face-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We were forced to abandon the island before his exact fate- Nedry runs back into his vehicle, but the SPITTER leaps i after him. Thrashing, BLOOD-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -or that of the material he had stolen could be determined. We PAN to the abandoned aerosol can, swept away by a rivu of rainwater and quickly covered with muck-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONGBIRDS flit about in the branches all around them as t approach the rustic-built SNACK BAR-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: But the people who took over the island-  ‘e

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Grendel International. If they had found it they wouldn’t be constantly pressuring me to reveal its whereabouts. I have good reason to believe they might be the people who engaged Nedry in his betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Why would they want dinosaur genes?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: I shudder to think. Hammond looks over the menu hanging above the snack bar counter-—

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Major Overton tells me you're an expert in covert operations.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I was trained as a Navy Seal. I've been involved in- missions, in and out of uniform.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: We know the sector Nedry was in when he disappeared. The stolen material seems to have been hidden in an aerosol can of some sort-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Deodorant.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Given the state of Nedry’s personal hygiene, I doubt it. We can provide you with a map-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There aren't any dinosaurs left on the island?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Grendel International claim to have- restored equilibrium. They maintain a small security force there to discourage trespassers-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So I go there and I steal this- 17.  e

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Reclaim-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I bring this can of DNA back to you.

dialogues.speaker: COHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: Captain Overton will be your contact. Hammond scribbles a number on a snack bar order pad, flas it to Nick, all the time wary of the approaching nurse. W see lots of zeros-

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: You will be amply rewarded for your risk, of course, with a generous bonus if you succeed. So? Nick considers, nods, resigned-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’ve done worse for less.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN HAMMOND
dialogues.text: (beaming) Excellent! Now- would you care for a sundae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start with an AERIAL SHOT of Isla Nublar in the distan across the water, then TILT DOWN to see a small local FIS BOAT in the FG-

dialogues.speaker: FISHING BOAT
dialogues.text: Overton is there, checking a GPS instrument, as the boat' owner, RAMIREZ, deals with a NET thrown over the side fac the island-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: This is the legal limit. There’s a couple patrol boats we'll hear from if we drift any closer. We PAN to see Nick, sitting on the deck beside the cabin (which blocks him from view from the island) and pulling the last of his black SCUBA GEAR-  e 19.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Give me ten minutes and then pull cut. You sure about this pilot?

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: They're used to seeing his plane around the coast. Eco-tours. Nick nods and pushes a camouflaged RAFT full of supplies overboard, clipping a nylon line attached to it to the ba of his belt. Ramirez comes over to watch as Nick lowers h mask and sits backwards en the gunwale-

dialogues.speaker: RAMIREZ
dialogues.text: Buena suerte, Senor. Nick nods, falls backward into the water and disappears. They watch the raft begin to pull away. Ramirez crosses himself-

dialogues.speaker: RAMIREZ
dialogues.text: Que Dios le proteja.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEACH looks inviting- gentle waves, strip of white sa a fringe of palm trees, little CRABS scuttling among the fallen coconuts. Suddenly Nick sits up in the surf, quick pulling off his flippers and mask and hustling across the sand to the shelter of the palms, dragging the supply raf behind him-

dialogues.speaker: PALMS
dialogues.text: Very precise, very Mission Impossible, Nick strips off th wet suit, opens the raft supply compartment. Boots on, backpack, GPS UNIT and LAMINATED MAP on a lanyard over hi neck, then the weapons- automatic combat SHOTGUN, small P RIFLE with silencer, .50-caliber PISTOL in one holster an cell phone in the other- Nick crouches, sticks a HOMING DEVICE, as yet unarmed, in the sand at the edge of the tree-line. He trots off into jungle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves quickly down an extremely overgrown PATHWAY, passing oddly-canted LAMP POSTS and torn, rusted sections metal FENCING.  20. This used to be the tourist track through the park. He st abruptly, listens- the usual Tarzan-movie JUNGLE SOUNDS, nothing you couldn’t hear on vacation. He checks his GPS, then trots away. We HOLD, then TILT UP the nearby LAMP POST to see a SURVEILLANCE CAMERA mounted near the top, swivelling to follow Nick's movement-

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE
dialogues.text: We shoot from GROUND LEVEL as Nick approaches from some distance, vaulting over a HOLE at the base of a gnarly-ro tree. We HOLD on the hole for a moment. A large, black, four- fingered REPTILE HAND emerges, CLAWS gripping the earth!

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: Nick is off the pathway now, moving through thick jungle he reaches a small CLEARING. He checks his map and GPS. H sees something, climbs a slight rise, pushes away some ta weeds. An abandoned, rusted-out 4-wheel-drive VEHICLE. Ni yanks a torn flap of canvas away to reveal- Nedry’s SKELETON! Bony fingers still clutching the steeri wheel. A SMALL LIZARD scuttles out through one of the eye sockets in the SKULL-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (regarding skeleton) Looks like you've dropped a few pounds. He rapidly searches the interior of the vehicle- seats, floor, glove compartment- nothing but a FLASHLIGHT and a of old CANDY WRAPPERS. He steps away, surveying the groun around him-

dialogues.speaker: BACKPACK
dialogues.text: The backpack thumps to the ground. Nick upzips it and pul out pieces of a disassembled METAL DETECTOR. An ANIMAL SCREAM from back in the trees- Nick listens. Quiet again. He glances at his watch, begins to assemble the metal detector-

dialogues.speaker: GROUND
dialogues.text: We see the metal detector disc sweeping over the ground-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, T-shirt soaked through with sweat, has set up a GRI with wooden stakes and string. He is working a section several yards down from the vehicle, at the edge of a sha little STREAM. He pauses, wipes sweat off his forehead. O a whim he reaches the detector arm over the string and pa the disc over a little mud-bar in the center of the strea The machine CRACKLES. Nick drops the detector and jumps into the stream, diggin furiously at the mud-bar with his hands. He stops, feelin something, then pulls up- -a muck-covered BARBASOL CAN! Nick kneels, washes the can off in the stream, then pulls his cell phone and punches a number-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yo. Objective secured. Proceed with extraction. I‘ll fire up the homer. He pulls a REMOTE CONTROL from his vest, pushes in a red button-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINKING RED LIGHT flicks on, the device BEEPING softly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick moves quickly but cautiously through thick jungle, passing by a few of the big ROOT-HOLES. He slows, frownin listening- A RUSTLE behind him. A SNAP to the side. He starts up again, very slowly. Again the RUSTLE in the brush around him. Him brings the shotgun up, crouching-

dialogues.speaker: JEFE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: !Bajelo! Nick freezes, turns his head-  22. 4 @ Out of the trees all arounij him appear a squad of six SECURITY RANGERS in camo uniforms, armed with short-barre AUTOMATIC RIFLES. The JEFE waves his rifle at Nick-

dialogues.speaker: JEFE
dialogues.text: Deje caer las armas y pdéngase al suelo.

dialogues.speaker: SEGUNDO
dialogues.text: He wants you to drop your weapons and lie on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JEFE
dialogues.text: No tenga miedo, nomads queremos la lata.

dialogues.speaker: SEGUNDO
dialogues.text: Don’t be afraid. We only want the can. Your escopeta, por favor, put it on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick takes a deep breath, calculating, looks around at th men surrounding him. He sees something- ‘e

dialogues.speaker: SEGUNDO
dialogues.text: Is very good we find you before the dinosaurs do.

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS, NICK
dialogues.text: We shoot from behind the Jefe and Segundo toward Nick-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I was told there aren’t any left on the island.

dialogues.speaker: SEGUNDO
dialogues.text: (smiles) Oh, there’s a few-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Like the one standing behind you?

dialogues.speaker: SEGUNDO
dialogues.text: e@ We shoot the Segundo in profile as he LAUGHS- ww  e © 23.

dialogues.speaker: SEGUNDO
dialogues.text: That won't work my friend. The ones left here only come out in the night- CHOMP! A RAPTCR’s head lunges into the shot, jaws clampin on Segundo's neck and shoulder! He SCREAMS-—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another RAPTOR pops up from the hole next to the Jefe. Th Rangers start to FIRE their weapons, as ANOTHER and ANOTH and ANOTHER jet-black, ruby-eyed EXCAVARAPTORS (‘digging killers’ or just DIGGERS) pop up from the holes- the men been standing in the middle of a colony of them! (These creatures are bow-legged, with huge, mole-like DIG CLAWS at the ends of their powerful forelimbs.) Bap-bap-bap-bap-bap-bap-bap! The Rangers have their rifle on spray and pray as they panic and scatter, the Jefe pin under one of the beasts’ powerful legs! Nick darts past the Segundo as the DIGGER lifts the man o his feet and shakes him. AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE rips into the trees around Nick as he dodges through the thick undergro a pair of the monsters pursuing him-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick zigzags between tree trunks, hurdles roots and falle logs while the bigger DIGGERS crash straight through, slo by the foliage. We hear SCREAMS and GUNFIRE from behind, growing more distant. Nick gets hung up on a prickler vin for a moment, the lead DIGGER gaining- Nick twists and BLAM! BLAM! blasts the creature in the fa and neck as it rushes in for the kill! The digger staggers, falls to one knee as Nick tears free sprints away. We HOLD as the second raptor reaches its wounded comrade, pauses, ROARS and then continues the cha

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: Nick staggers, bleeding from the pricker vine, into an overgrown CLEARING. He leans his back against the grill o an abandoned SERVICE VEHICLE, faded ‘Jurassic Park’ logo its side. He catches his breath, listening, quickly reloading his shotgun—  ‘e ©@ 24. A pointy little lizard-face pops up behind him, looking o through the shattered windshield of the vehicle. COMPSOGNATHUS. It is joined by ANOTHER, and ANOTHER and SEVERAL MORE. Cc SQUEAKS. Nick stiffens, then whirls- BLAM! he FIRES just as a dozen of the little carnivores stream out of the window at him, the ones that aren’t blo back into the vehicle by the blast leaping onto his face, shoulders, chest, arms, SQUEAKING excitedly! Nick spins, swatting and snatching, compys flying off him, then sprin for the nearby BUILDING. We HOLD on his abandoned SHOTGUN lying on the ground-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shoot through a half-broken WINDOW as Nick sprints tow us, a dozen COMPYS in pursuit. He picks up speed, dives, folding his arms over his head- CRASH! Shards of glass go flying as he dives through the window, does a forward rol twists and comes up on one knee pulling his PISTOL from h holster in one motion- POP! POP! POP! POP! He picks off the compys one by one as they jump onto the windowsill! The rest of them seem to take the hint. Nick lowers his b on the window opening, looks around- We are in a dusty STAFF BARRACKS- a half-dozen BUNK BEDS, frames draped with COBWEBS along the walls, footlockers, old boombox, a coffeemaker in one corner by a row of stan lockers. Simple but not spartan. A POSTER of a TYRRANOSAURUS is starting to curl on the wa Someone has drawn a knife and a fork in its front claws, written in a cartoon balloon above its head- “Pass the tourists, please.” Nick pulls the laminated map off his neck, studies it-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (reading) Staff Quarters One, Two and Three--- utility tunnel-

dialogues.speaker: ECU MAP
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Nick's FINGER over the detailed diagram of the Park, DOTTED LINES indicating a utility tunnel that leads from the staff barracks to a power station near the south fence-

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -leads to the power station-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: -which is only two hundred yards from the beach. Nick looks around, steps over to a HATCH in one corner of room. He bends, grabs the handle, pistol ready in his oth hand, then yanks the hatch cover open! Nothing jumps out at him. Nick looks down into the BLACKNESS. He un-velcros a small but powerful FLASHLIGHT from his belt, shines it down the hatch-

dialogues.speaker: HATCH
dialogues.text: We see a rusted metal LADDER leading down, a cement floor

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick considers the tunnel, looks back to the window- Three compys stand ready on the windowsill, watching- Nick whips his pistol around but they jump away before he fire- He looks back into the dark tunnel below-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No way, José. He looks around, sees-- A CEILING HATCH over one of the bunk beds. Nick crosses, makes a face as he swipes away thick sheets COBWEB, climbs onto the top bunk, reaches up. The EYEHOOK and LATCH have rusted stuck together, they won't budge. N takes the butt of his pistol, gives it a hard rap- The hatch falls open and the top half of a half-eaten DEA MAN drops through!  ®

Nick SHOUTS in surprise, leaping backwards off the bed an sprawling onto the flcor, whipping his pistol up ready to shoot- The BODY is a Security Fanger who has been gnawed on pret bad, maybe a week old. Nick lowers his pistol, breathes deeply, trying to get hi heartbeat under control- WHAM! The DIGGER crashes through the front door and tumbl across the room, sliding on the floor and knocking the coffeemaker and standing lockers down on top of itself! Nick is trapped in the corner. The digger scrambles to it feet, ROARS, lunges- Nick pulls the bunk bed down over himself as a shield, crouching- THOONK! the raptor’s leg goes right through the deteriora mattress and springs, claws just missing Nick‘s throat. H scrambles out as the beast writhes to free itself, makes to the tunnel hatch and starts down the ladder, grabbing handle on the underside of the cover-

dialogues.speaker: LADDER, NICK'S FEET
dialogues.text: CRACK! The rusted metal rungs give way, snapping, Nick falling but able to yank the hatch cover- THUNK! THUMP! Nick hits the tunnel floor and the hatch cover falls shut, throwing us into BLACKNESS. CRANG! Raptor CLAWS punch through the hatch cover, then y away, tearing away the thin metal! Three stripes *f DAYLI appear to illuminate Nick below, getting to his feet. CRA the raptor tears at the hatch cover again. Nick flicks th flashlight back on, trots into the dark, high-ceilinged tunnel ahead-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see through the palms to a small PONTOON PLANE approac over the sea-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jerry-rigged HOMING SCREEN clipped to the control panel a BLINKING RED LIGHT lined up with the central cross hair  ‘e 27.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: The pilot, a hippie-looking character in a Deadhead shirt named DARWIN, scans the beach-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: You're sposed to be here, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BEACH
dialogues.text: We watch as the plane slows and comes in for a water land TRACKING to meet it as it taxis up to the surfline. Darwin cuts the engine, hops out and into the water, wrestling the little plane around so it is pointing out t sea, MUTTERING all the while-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: This gig is gnarly enough without being late, man. Security guards, spy gear, probly some kind of psychosauruses still running around the island- He runs a line from a U-bolt under the tail assembly to a thick ROOT sticking up from a half-buried DRIFTWOOD STUMP glancing at his watch-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: I give you ten minutes and then I'm history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is trotting along the utility tunnel, pipes and wire overhead. So far, so good. He stops at a FORK in the tunnel, shines the light on his map-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There's no fork on the damn map- HRRRRRRRRRONK! The ROAR of the digger ECHOES down the tun behind him. No time for eenie meenie minie moe. Nick runs xright- CRUNCH! CRUNCH! CRUNCH! Something underfoot- Nick swings the light down- EGGSHELLS. Big ones. Dozens of them, all over the floor-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Terrific. It’s the nursery-  ‘e 28. HRRRRRONK! Another echoing ROAR sends Nick running again. We HOLD and watch him trot away. Something, in SILHOUETTE drops from the pipes above and FOLLOWS!

dialogues.speaker: LOW-ANGLE
dialogues.text: Trotting past us. As his light FADES a pair of yellow REPTILE EYES right in front of us POP OPEN!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We TRACK BEHIND Nick as he rushes along. Up ahead we can a single SHAFT of SUNLIGHT angling down- the light at the of the tunnel. Closer, closer- Nick points the flashlight beam ahead to see- Three SPITTERS standing between him and the exit ladder! The one closest HISSES, its frilled MANTLE popping up in display. Nick whirls around, shines the light- Here come four more spitters and behind them HRRRRRONK! t digger closing in! Nick turns- POP! POP! POP! POP! The spitters back up a bit but don’t run as Nick opens FIRE on them. He clenches the pistol in his mouth, jumps- and grabs onto the pipes above, swinging forward hand-to-hand, bringing his knees to his chest as the spitters jump and snap beneath him, t just inches away! One of the spitters scrambles up the exit ladder ahead, t BLAM! BLAM! Nick FIRES, hanging by one arm for a moment. The spitter falls and Nick drops the pistol, swings forwa and hooks the top of the ladder with a foot-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick crawls out of the tunnel opening, runs. A spitter po up right behind him, looks around- then is YANKED back in the hatchway by its tail! SNARLING, CHOMPING NOISES, then the DIGGER powers its way of the opening, sniffs once, and heads after Nick-  ‘e 29.

dialogues.speaker: FENCE
dialogues.text: Nick looks at the twelve-foot-high fence above him, back the charging raptor. He slips his backpack off, tries to squeeze through a very narrow OPENING that some short ani has torn at the base of the fence. He gets hung up, squir and slips through just as WHAM! the digger smashes into t fence headfirst trying to grab him! Nick springs to his feet, sees that the backpack is just the far side of the fence, the BARBASOL CAN visible in a webbing pocket. The digger starts to DIG furiously at the base of the fence, huge clods of dirt flying behind him. Nick runs parallel to the fence, SLAPPING it with his han

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come on you stupid lizard, come and get me! Come on, knucklehead! The raptor leaves his digging and begins to run parallel the other side, catching up with Nick-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That's it, Einstein, follow the nice man- thattabo- Nick puts on the brakes as he sees ahead- Twenty yards further down a whole section of fence has fa The raptor sees it too. They look at each other-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: See you on the beach. Nick sprints back toward the original hole and his backpa The raptor takes a step after him, thinks, then turns to for the open section-

dialogues.speaker: FENCE, BACKPACK
dialogues.text: Nick races back, thrusts his arm through the hole and gra the backpack, yanks it through and runs for the trees, pulling the Barbasol can free and discarding the backpack

dialogues.speaker: BEACH
dialogues.text: Darwin is looking at his watch-  ®

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Well, you're just in time to be too late, my man. I’m outta here-

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! We PAN with Darwin's look to see Nick break out of the treeline onto the sand a couple hundred yards away, sprin toward him-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Start it up! Darwin hurries out onto a pontoon and climbs into the coc

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: No problem, dude. He hits the ignition and the engine COUGHS into action, t PROP spinning, picking up revs-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Lift anchor and we're airborne-

dialogues.speaker: HRRRRRONK
dialogues.text: He swivels to see the DIGGER bust out of the trees, not m than thirty yards away!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick pulls up short, the monster between him and the plan He makes a beeline for the water, calling out-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Taxi out, I‘ll swim to you!

dialogues.speaker: DIGGER
dialogues.text: The raptor takes a look at Nick, already splashing into t surf, then at the big, noisy thing at the water’s edge. I chooses the easier prey, charging toward the plane, BELLO

dialogues.speaker: PLANE, DARWIN
dialogues.text: Darwin panics, jams the throttle forward-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhgh!  e The plane blasts forward, but the tide has risen and ther a lot of slack in the line from the tail-

dialogues.speaker: DRIFTWCOD STUMP
dialogues.text: CRACK! The line snaps taut and YANKS the root it was tied clear off from the stump!

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: The plane picks up speed, the big driftwood root skitteri in its wake-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wood skips and splashes on the surface like a dropped water-skiing handle. Just as it hops past the camera ther is a sudden RISING in the water beside us- was that the c of an enormous wedge-shaped REPTILE HEAD or were we just seeing things? We PAN to see as the plane lifts off-

dialogues.speaker: DIGGER
dialogues.text: Thigh deep in the surf, it BELLOWS in frustration as the plane buzzes away-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick is swimming out to sea for all he’s worth. He looks back to shore- unless that thing can do the Australian cr he’s made it. He treads water, waves to the sky-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Come back! It’s all clear! We PAN to the sky, and yes, the plane is banking, turning coming back and dropping toward the surface-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Easy, buddy, easy. No sweat now-—

dialogues.speaker: PLANE
dialogues.text: The plane steadies, pontoons skimming the water’s surface  32.

dialogues.speaker: DRIFTWOOD ROOT
dialogues.text: The hunk of wood skittering along again, till- WHOOSH! CHOMP! A KRONOSAURUS, gigantic sea-monster that i is, shoots its eight-foot-long head up and snatches the trolling bait in its powerful jaws! CRACK! The line snaps taut and RIPS the whole tail sectio of the plane off!

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT, DARWIN
dialogues.text: Darwin instinctively yanks back on the joystick, trying t pull up-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Whooooooah!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick watches, shocked, as the plane pulls up but can’t ho its yaw with the tail gone. It spirals, heading back straight at Nick, arcing toward the water- closer, closer Nick takes a breath and goes UNDER-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick tries to get deeper as the shape of the plane passes close overhead and we hear a MUFFLED, WATERY CRASH!

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: Nick pops back up to the surface, looks around- we PAN to the plane sitting sideways in the water fifty yards away, chunks of wing torn off and already floating. It settles upside-down, the pontoons still on the surface keeping it afloat. A beat. Darwin comes up sputtering, hauls himself onto one of the pontoons, and sits gasping for breath. He sees Nick swimm toward him, calls-

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Hey, man, what happened?  2

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (swimming, calls) I just saw your tail section come off.

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) It never did that before. You got a phone?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. A wet one.

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: (sees) Hey- those security dudes don’t have like a- a submarine, do they? We PAN with his GAZE-- Something big and long is moving fast, just under the wat surface, straight at Darwin on the wrecked plane!

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Darwin is standing now, backing his toes away from the wa

dialogues.speaker: DARWIN
dialogues.text: Cause unless that’s Flipper, I'm- WHOOSH! SNAP! SPLASH! The KRONOSAURUS breaks surface, snatches Darwin in its jaws, half its enormous body clear water, then SMACKING down into the water and diving, a hu SERRATED FLUKE slapping the surface as it disappears!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick is stunned for a second, then looks to the shore- The DIGGER is stalking the beach, watching him. Can‘t go back there- Nick begins to swim parallel to the shore, looking around signs of the sea monster. He hears the CHOP of a HELICOPT looks up-

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: A gunship-style HELICOPTER is racing across the water tow him, flying low over the water, a RESCUE LADDER already b lowered-  ‘e ‘eo

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick begins to swim toward it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look from above at Nick swimming, then TILT to see the KRONOSAURUS’s back and forehead break water as it surface swim after him-

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE
dialogues.text: On the first pass the ladder swings just out of Nick’s re going too fast. He sees the Kronosaurus now, raising its head as it streaks toward him, opening its jaws— The helicopter banks and hovers- Nick grabs the ladder! H pulls himself up a few feet, shouts to the rescuers above

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Take it up! Take it up!

dialogues.speaker: KRONOSAURUS
dialogues.text: We ride the back of the Kronosaurus as it powers toward N who is still dangling temptingly only a few feet above th water's surface. We look over its massive, barnacled, hor head as it lunges up- SNAP! just missing the bottom of th ladder as the helicopter suddenly shoots up into the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shoot out the side bay, seeing the Kronosaurus and Isl Nublar receding in the distance. Strong arms appear to dr Nick in. He lies back on the floor, chest heaving-— The man who leans over in his face is wearing the same Grendel Corporation Security Ranger UNIFORM as the men on island-

dialogues.speaker: NANDO
dialogues.text: I hope you haven't forgotten our can, Mr. Harris. Nick raises his head slightly, taps his ear as if he can’ hear-  ‘e © 35.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sorry, can’t hear you! The helicopter noi- WHAP! Nando smashes him flush in the face. LIGHTS OUT. DARKNESS. Silence. Then, slowly, the sound of the HELICOPTER FADES back UP, well as the LIGHT- Nick is lying on the floor still, BLOOD on his face. He opens his eyes slowly, blinks- He sees the BARBASOL CAN lying on Nando’s lap just an arm reach away. Nando is busy joking in Spanish with the pilo Nick swivels his eyes- He can see below out the side bay. They are cruising fair low over the water, parallel to a thickly populated BEACH Lots of SWIMMERS in the water- Nick checks to see that his hands and legs are free, gath his strength-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overton stands among the beach blankets, running kids and sunbathers, watching the horizon, worried. A LITTLE BOY approaches, selling SHARK-TOOTH NECKLACES-

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Sefior- équiere comprar un collar?

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: éHas visto un avidn? We hear the HELICOPTER approaching. Chico points up to it

dialogues.speaker: CHICO
dialogues.text: Aqui esta- Overton mimes a plane’s wings with his arms-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: No- un avién con alas-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick takes a couple deep breaths, then lunges, grabbing t aerosol can from Nando and rolling-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -out the open bay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GASP from the spectators on the beach as the man falls of the helicopter and into the water forty feet below, th APPLAUSE as he pops up to the surface and swims rapidly toward shore. They think it’s a stunt. The helicopter ban over the water and heads back to cut him off- Overton walks toward the shore, unsteady on the sand- Nick stands, struggling to get out of the water, hits the beach running through the delighted beach crowd till WHOO the chopper swoops down at him from behind, struts narrow missing his head as he dives for the ground, rotors BLAST SAND at the now terrified people! Nick is up running again, aerosol can in hand, shouting t Overton as he sprints past him-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ask for a cold one at Rodrigo’s! Overton turns and watches Nick duck into the cover of the lunch palapas and fried-everything stands at the back edg the beach, the buildings of the resort town rising behind them. The HELICOPTER hovers above, turning this way and t like an indecisive hummingbird-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELICOPTER SOUND from above as Nick hustles down a BACK ALLEY, hugging the wall to stay out of sight from the sky He darts across the alley and in through the BACK DOOR of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KITCHEN - RODRIGO‘S An OLD MAN sits at a small table shucking OYSTERS. He bar locks up as Nick enters, crosses to check out the action the bar, then turns to look around the kitchen-

dialogues.speaker: COOLER
dialogues.text: An ancient Coca Cola COOLER buzzes in one corner. Nick mo to it, lifts the lid, and sets the BARBASOL CAN in the mi of dozens of BOTTLES OF BEER. He turns to the Old Man-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Voy a enviar alguien para recuperarlo. (I‘ll send somebody to get this.) The Old Man shrugs and keeps on shucking. Nick looks up a the HELICOPTER SOUND grows LOUDER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VENDOR pushes his cart down a back street, hawking popsicles-

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Paletas! Muy frescos, muy ricos! Aqui tengo las paletas! He passes and we see Nick, looking pretty beat up, standi back in a doorway. He is checking out the little HOTEL DELPHiN across the street as he speaks softly on a CELL P

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Just do what we agreed on before. I'll contact you when I’m in the clear. EXT. STREET - RODRIGO’S BAR Overton stands at the pay phone across the street from a called RODRIGO’S. Beyond him we see THUGS wearing sunglas cruising up and down the street, on the lookout for Nick-

dialogues.speaker: OVERTON
dialogues.text: It's very hot right now. Keep your head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick on his cell phone-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I‘1ll do my best. Nick clicks the cell phone off, pockets it. He considers hotel, decides it is worth a try, limps across toward it-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DESK CLERK is reading a comic book. He doesn’t look u when Nick limps in-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Joven- éha sido alguien buscaéndome? éEsperdndome en el cuarto?

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Harris- nobody been lookin for you. Nick considers, reaches to take his key from its cubbyhol

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Nick limps towards us down the corridor. He turns the key opens the door-- Nando stands there with a different aero can in his hand, pointed at Nick’s face. Nick is too exhausted to run-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: SSSSSSST
dialogues.text: Nando hits the button and sprays Nick in the face. LIGHTS OUT again. DARKNESS. Silence But this time as the LIGHT begins to FADE UP it is with t sound of YODELLING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick wakes in a cozy-looking bed in a round, stone-walled room. He looks around, confused- yodelling? He sits up, barefoot, wearing clean pants and a T-shirt. stands, steadies himself, a little woozy- then crosses immediately to the thick oaken DOOR, tries it-- locked. He crosses to the opposite side of the room and sticks hi head out a tall, rectangular OPENING-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Nick’s head pop out through the window of a STONE TOWER at one corner of a MEDIEVAL CASTLE on a mountainsid the SWISS ALPS. He looks right- on the opposite PARAPET a two YODELERS in archaic lederhosen and plumed hats, givin their tonsils a workout for a crowd of TOURISTS standing on the other side of the MOAT. The Yodelers finish, the Tourists APPLAUD enthusiastically, and Nick ducks his hea back in-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I‘m a prisoner in a theme park. He looks around-- his suitcase is open on a stand, his ja hanging in an armoire. Heraldic BANNERS hang on the walls There is a TV SET and remote control. He picks up the remote, flicks the set ON, begins to surf- French-speaking channels, German-speaking channels, Spani Italian- we're definitely in Europe here. He settles on a channel playing a NATURE DOCUMENTARY about the dinosaur pests, the NARRATOR with a plummy British accent-

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (TV)
dialogues.text: Compsognathus rarely exceed a full- grown pheasant in size-

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see a trio of COMPYS making forays in to bite at a cornered, hissing RACCOON-

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (TV)
dialogues.text: -but though diminutive are extremely aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No kidding. He flicks the TV OFF. A booming KNOCK at the door-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (calling) It’s locked! A KEY fumbling, then the door opens to reveal a BUTLER dressed in livery. He has a slight Swiss accent-

dialogues.speaker: BUTLER
dialogues.text: They are ready for you downstairs, Mr. Harris. The Butler steps away without closing the door. Nick considers-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, fully-dressed now, comes down a STONE STAIRCASE tha Basil Rathbone should be swordfighting on, to see- ADRIEN JOYCE, a man only slightly older than Nick and ver fit, swinging a HALBERD around in an elaborate martial-ar display, thrusting, parrying, chopping, slicing-- thoroug enjoying himself till he sees that Nick has entered. He freezes in a backswing, smiles-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: It’s not only for ceremony, you know. The halberd. The Swiss Guards who protect the Pope at the Vatican could do a good deal of damage with these- of course they‘ve also got an automatic pistol somewhere under those crazy uniforms-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Maybe you should apply for a job. Joyce crosses to hang the halberd over the enormous FIREP  ‘e 41.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I haven‘t seen you since, what- ?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Tegucigalpa. I helped get you kicked out of the country.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: To be deported from Hondures- what horror must I have perpetrated?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Selling guns to the wrong people, as I recall.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: But they were the right people when I began the transaction. The political sands are ever-shifting- He indicates the very huge GREAT HALL around them-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Something the Swiss understand better than anyone. This castle was built in the late fifteenth century by a local warlord and self- styled baron seeking to isolate himself from the endless armed conflicts of Europe, and, if possible, to profit from them. Joyce indicates a huge TAPESTRY hanging on the wall, portraying a bloody battle with horses, lances, swords, shields and plenty of dead foot soldiers littering the battlefield-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: He hired men and trained them to fight, selling- I should say renting- their services to whomever put cash on the barrelhead. Security forces, invasions, sieges- the Swiss mercenary was a force to be reckoned with. My employer, the current Baron von Drax, is principal stockholder and CEO of the Grendel International Corporation.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You make a hell of a tour guide, Joyce. What do you want with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something that belongs to us.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I lost it in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We'll match Hammond's offer.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I made my deal with him.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (concerned) But you haven't delivered it, have you? Nick makes a quick assessment of his situation-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s- it’s somewhere safe.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm happy to hear that, e Nick. Joyce crosses to Nick-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I do apologize for the abrupt nature of your transportation here, but the sensitive nature of the material in question-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Like that it’s illegal- An edge of menace enters Joyce’s tone-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: There was some consideration given to torturing the whereabouts out of you. I suggested that, given your history, this would be counterproductive. (smiles) Besides, we want you to work for us. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELECTRIC LAMPS on old torch sconces light the way as Joyc leads Nick down a narrow passageway on another stone

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Grendel plans to use the material from Jurassic Park in much the same way as that envisioned by yceur Mr. Hammond-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: The United Nations-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: When the infestation of creatures begins to seriously inconvenience the First World, the United Nations will snap to attention. Previously rejected solutions, drastic as they may seem, will be reconsidered- solutions we‘d be able to offer.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: For a price.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Naturally. And then there's a related project, the one we hope you'll become involved in- Nick slows as he hears a massive POUNDING ahead, like a p driver rhythmically destroying a paved parking lot-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Remodelling?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (smiles) That‘s what we tell the tourists. He unlatches a DUNGEON DOOR in front of them, and they st into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand on the entry PLATFORM above a well-lit stone DUNGEON, a few old CHAINS still bolted to the walls for effect.

Below them, nearly filling the room, is a heavily-plated ANKYLOSAURUS, repeatedly thrashing the bowling-ball-sized bone protuberance at the end of its massive tail as a cud knocking dents into the wall and sending rock-dust flying

dialogues.speaker: NICK, JOYCE
dialogues.text: Joyce tries to fit his words in between the rhythmic WHAM the ankylosaurus's assault-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: A souvenir from our clean-up effort on Isla Nubla. We raised it from an egg-

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: From an embryo, to be precise. SHERMAN has appeared behind them. He is a young genetics whiz and sorely lacking in ‘people skills‘-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Nick, this is our chief of Applied Genetics, Sherman Fosdick-

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: (plowing through) Like the embryos you stole from us. (points to ankylosaurus) Maybe we should put him down with her for awhile-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Be polite, Sherman. We haven't even had dinner yet. Joyce leads Nick away, whispering as they go-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Too much Dungeons and Dragons, not enough socializing with the other children-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Why bother having that thing if you're going to keep it shut up in a dungeon?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Oh- one never knows when an ankylosaurus might come in handy. They have reached another metal-reinforced door. This one however, opens with a swipe of Joyce's ID card-  ‘oe (e@

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: re a

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Come see the new wing-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Joyce step into something out of a James Bond mo a CAVERN hollowed out in the core of the mountain beneath castle, metal stairs leading down into a maze of brightly biological-testing LABS-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: The castle sits on an enormous cavern in the mountain. The original Baron kept his wine down here. We've expanded a bit- They start down the stairs-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: The corporation paid for all this?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We have several products that are doing very well at the moment- an insect-resistant rye grain, super- strains of hops and barley- and of course we were the first in Europe to market pre-sliced cheese. Dairy is very important here in Switzerland-

dialogues.speaker: RRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAARGH
dialogues.text: A chilling ROAR echoes throughout the chamber—

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: One of your cows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An 8ft-tall DEINONYCHUS trots in circles, slams itself against the I-beams that enclose it, ROARS, and generally throws a fit in a bull-ring-sized ENCLOSURE. Spray-painte in day-glo orange on its side is ‘X-1', and attached to o side of its head, just above the ear-hole, is a REGULATOR about the size of a cell phone-  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman in a lab coat with the ubiquitous Grendel International logo on the pocket stands watching the beas and writing on a CHART. This is MAYA LUNDBERG. Several TV SCREENS are mounted on the wall above her, providing vari angles of the beast’s activity, while the panel in front her sports a half-dozen VITAL FUNCTION MONITORS of the EE MRI and heart-rate sort. She dcesn’'t look up from her wo

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: This is X-1, our alpha male- not in the best of moods at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: If you keep them in captivity you‘ve got to accept a certain amount of neurotic behavior.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Training, not captivity, please-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Whatever-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Maya Lundberg, our head of Behavioral Modification. Meet Mr. Harris- This gets Maya’s attention. She turns to check Nick out-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The trespasser?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (to Nick) We all followed your progress on the island. Sort of like an episode of Survivor- Nick steps up to the window and looks in at the raging be

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So this is what, like a mid-sized Tyrranosaurus?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Deinonychus. ‘Terrible claw’ in Latin.  ‘6 47.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: (rejoining them) Deinonychus draxi. It‘s a sub-species. Sherman checks a timer, looks at the panel instruments-

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Wow- look at that adrenaline-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (concerned and annoyed) Would you shut him down? He’s going to hurt himself.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: X-1 is too cagey to hurt himself, no matter how much we pump him up- Sherman steps up to a RADIO TRANSMITTER, punches the time turns a dial-

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Call out when the reticular formation goes blue- Maya is watching a BRAIN SCAN image which is rapidly chan from RED to cooler colors- The DEINONYCHUS begins to stagger a bit, appears confused

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: (excited) Look at that! And I'm only restricting acetylcholine-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Don‘t make him fall over again, His ribs-

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: (dialing) Come on, baby, nice soft landing- The deinonychus lowers itself into a CROUCH, partly supporting itself with its shorter front legs, breathing heavily and staring somewhat glassily into space. Nick is amazed-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We've placed a few strategic implants to let us control its hormones by radio signal-  ‘oe 48.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Not hormones, neuropeptides-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Right now it’s experiencing something like acute chronic fatigue syndrome. Before you came in the parts of its gray matter controlling rage and aggressive behavior were stimulated.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: You remember the cockfights in Honduras? When a rooster gets mad, blood flows into its comb, responding to the adrenaline. But if the handler put the comb in his mouth and sucked blood into it- the rooster got mad before he even saw his opponent.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: Fortunately for us, reptiles have a very compartmentalized brain, just like chickens. We don’t get much spillover when we want to induce a specific emotion.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: For what purpose? Maya and Sherman look to Joyce-- it’s not their place to out this information-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Let's leave that for tomorrow. You must be exhausted- you'll travelled all the way from the Jurassic Era to the 21st century. Maya steps forward and takes his hand-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Mr. Harris- I look forward to working with you. Joyce takes a last look in at the pacified X-1-  ‘e 2 49.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick surreptitiously glances down at his hand. Maya has palmed a torn corner of her behavior chart into it, on wh she has written- Do not give them the embryos!

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You kind of wonder what he’s thinking, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick and Maya exchange a quick look, then Nick turns to l at the dinosaur. X-1 seems to focus for a moment, meeting his eye-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He’s wondering which one of us he should eat first. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAND ROVER with an open observation port cut in the roo glides over a spectacular MOUNTAIN PASS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Joyce sit on the bench seat in the rear as KRONE Joyce’s unctuous aide de camp, drives-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We have our own valley to work in, and being the principal employer in the canton affords its own protection. The Swiss, as the world knows, are quite capable of keeping a secret. They roll past a SECURITY CHECKPOINT, waved through by th

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: The west road, Kroner.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Something the boys in Africa used to call me. Joyce stands to look out from the port, Nick following-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several bunker-like BUILDINGS and large CAGED ENCLOSURES clustered in the bowl of the little valley. They pull up beside a long cement CHUTE with a steel-mesh roof that extends out of the side of the mountain- Sherman and Maya are waiting in a cut-away HUMVEE with a dashboard filled with the kinds of monitors and controls saw in the underground observation room. Around them in various PURSUIT VEHICLES are the TRAINING STAFF-- a dozen eo hard-looking MERCENARIES with an array of long-handled » ELECTRIC PRODS, wicked-looking RESTRAINTS and heavy dut

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (calls over) Has the objective been set up?

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: We‘re ready to rip.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Let’s bring them out, then. Nick realizes what‘s going on-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Whooah, now, you’re not going to let-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I assure you, they’re totally under control. and stand in the open, standing several yards away from t @ A DEINONYCHUS, and then ANOTHER, trot out through the c humans, watching them warily.  51. e Both have regulators on the side of their heads. We can < by the spray-paint on their sides that tnis is xX-2 and (Orestes and Ferseus)-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: These are more of those deino-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: -nychus draxi. They already possessed the super-sensitive smell and hearing, the power, the pack- hunting instincts we desired, then Sherman got busy splicing genes.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: (impressed with himself) A section of DNA from the egg-stealing raptor, Ornitholestes, to lengthen the forelegs and give them more dexterity with the fingers, a section from the domestic dog that seems to foster obedience and ® receptivity to training, and a small section of human DNA that we hope will increase their problem- solving ability.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: If you don’t get a leash on those things we’re going to have a major problem to solve-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Maya? Let‘s give Mr. Harris a demonstration. Maya stands in the Humvee, calls out in a commanding voic

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Raptors! The beasts respond, turning to watch her intently. She signals with her arm, pointing down the dirt road that le ahead into a stand of TREES-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Forward! ® X-2 and X-3 begin to trot down the road, Kroner pulls o follow them, and the whole menagerie of vehicles joins in Maya's control Humvee just behind the Land Rover-  52. Joyce hands Nick a thick red ARMBAND, about the size of a blood-pressure cuff, like the ones he and all the other s are wearing-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Put this on. It releases pheromones the raptors have been trained to avoid. Nick slips the armband on-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It doesn't smell like anything-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: To them it does. Nick watches the beasts trotting up ahead-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: They look different. The raptors have, in fact, changed color since they first came out of the chute, from GRAYISH to a mottled GREEN-BR that matches the countryside around them- ‘e

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: They're regular chameleons- put them in front of a brick wall and you'd swear you can see the mortar.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (nods) So we're taking them for a stroll-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We're in convoy, moving through enemy territory. Nick gives him a look-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I think you've let this Colonel thing get to your head. Joyce just smiles as they enter the TREES, the road narro somewhat— The deinonychus slow down up ahead, then stop, alert- ‘oe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick shots of the raptors’ NOSTRILS sniffing, EYES darti

dialogues.speaker: NICK, JOYCE
dialogues.text: Nick looks around them into the trees-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What‘s out there?

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: They'll know before we do.

dialogues.speaker: X-1
dialogues.text: The raptors suddenly dart away into the trees to the left SHRIEKING with aggression! AUTOMATIC GUNFIRE opens up fro the position they're running at, an AMBUSH EMPLACEMENT du beneath a huge fallen log-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Nick ducks instinctively, but Joyce remains standing-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it’s blank ammunition. Have to get them used to the noise-

dialogues.speaker: RAPTORS
dialogues.text: The raptors hit the bunker on the dead run, the lead one leaping and landing on the log above the firing position both legs, the second charging straight in and thrusting the opening with its ‘terrible claw’. The two rapidly demolish the position, soft dirt and chun of bark, wood and moss flying in every direction, till th have unearthed a rectangular iron PROTECTIVE CAGE contain two terrified MERCENARIES who have dropped their weapons SCREAM for help as the massive creatures roll the whole t over and over, jabbing in with their sickle-claws and STOMPING the bars out of shape!  54.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: The other Mercenaries have dismounted and move forward nervously with their various weapons and gear-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Shut them down, Sherman-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman is worried, watching his instrument panel-

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: They‘re on full restraint already! Nick leaps out of the Land Rover, grabs the nastiest weap he sees (something like a RPG launcher) from a mercenary, aims-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Grab him! Mercenaries dive on Nick, wrestling the grenade launcher him and pinning him on the ground- The raptors are subdued as well, breathing heavily but sitting back on their haunches on either side of the batt protective cage. The men inside are equally battered but alive- Maya walks out to within a few yards of them, hands held before her-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Easy, easy- Nick watches from the ground, amazed at her courage (or stupidity) - Maya turns and calls to Sherman in the control vehicle-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Give them a blast of serotonin as a reward. Sherman twists a dial- The raptors’ eyes half-close with bliss-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: All right, just a little get-up-and- go-  55. @ Sherman tweaks a different dial. Maya points back towar chute—

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Raptors! Home! Amazingly, the two monsters right themselves, and, totall ignoring the cage, begin to move back toward the road and chute-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Let him up. The Mercenaries warily let Nick go. He sits up, watches t deinonychus pass-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You almost got those men killed.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: On the contrary- we were just saved from a deadly ambush by our advance scouts. The Mercenaries remount their vehicles and begin to follo the deinonychus back, while a pair of MEDICS hurry to the cage-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Why should some poor grunt have to walk point through enemy territory if you’ve got these creatures to do it? When Cortés conquered Mexico he unleashed ferocious dogs on the terrified Aztecs-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: -who were fighting with arrows and spears. With real bullets-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: In a combat situation they’1l be fully armored. Just think of the psychological effect- talk about your shock and awe-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (fully realizing) You want to use them as soldiers!  © JOYCE SWAT team, (proud) Shock troops, riot control, search and destroy-- the ultimate in special forces. Maya hops into the Humvee, not happy-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (to Sherman) What took it so long?

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure-- they were overexcited-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The fact is you don't know. They pull away. Nick walks over toward the cage. The Medi have had no luck getting the twisted entry lid to open-

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: (to Joyce) We’re going to have to torch this to get it open.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: We'll send somebody out. He watches Nick, who is still a bit shaken-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: You‘ve been the first man in on some of these operations, Nick, you know the casualty rate-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You can‘t control them.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Maya has taken them a long way, but she’s not a professional soldier. Nick turns to look at him. This is the pitch-

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: I know your history Nick- you’ve always done what you were told extremely well and never asked too many questions. You've been used and abused and don’t have much to show for it. Isn't it time you got paid what you’re worth?  \e 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smaller deinonychus, X-5 (Achilles), wearing a kind of HARNESS around its body, paces in an outdoor ENCLOSURE ab the size of the lion tamer’s cage at the circus. A HUNK O BEEF is hung just outside the bars. X-5 approaches it war ZZZZZZZZ2TTTTTT! it receives an enormous ELECTRICAL JOLT, administered by ZEISS, a rather sadistic mercenary at a console just beyond the bars-

dialogues.speaker: ZEISS
dialogues.text: We have learned our lesson, maybe? The Humvee pulls up and Maya charges out of it-

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
